summary:
As a professional Frontend Developer I have around 4.5 years of experience and, I possess expertise in React, Redux, Javascript, Zustand TypeScript, Next.js, SCSS, Tailwind CSS, and more. Throughout my career, I've contributed to over 35+ web projects, catering to a diverse range of clients from finance to e-commerce. Additionally, I've worked on DeFi projects and cryptocurrency trading platforms, expanding my knowledge in these domains.

Passionate about web technologies, I adopt a continuous learning approach to enhance my skills. Currently, I'm immersing myself in Flutter and Dart, with future aspirations to delve into Blockchain Development.

experience.description: At RecruiterFlow, I work as a Frontend Developer, focusing on building reusable components and developing web applications with cutting-edge features. These applications are utilized by thousands of users in their daily routines.
achievements: Redesigned the application form, which is used by more than 1 million people every week. Implemented React similarly to how Meta does it, by injecting it inside the webpage instead of building the entire page with React. This solution significantly increased the speed of the website.
Implemented OpenAI and Bard APIs to automate text writing. Added the speech-to-action feature to enable users to perform actions using voice commands.

Worked on upgrading the Frontend libraries in our very large project with a lot of dependencies. Achieved 100% uptime and zero bugs in production by upgrading chunks of libraries at a time, starting with Node and React. Received praise from the CTO for this accomplishment.

Integrated RF-GPT into our SaaS product, which helps recruiters automate tasks such as email writing, job description creation, and call logs. This feature enhances their workflow by generating screening questions, saving them significant time and effort.

highlights.title: Test Infrastructure & Coverage Expansion (550+ Tests)
details: Took ownership of setting up and expanding the frontend testing ecosystem
Introduced TypeScript for better type safety and scalability
Integrated Jest and React Testing Library (RTL) for robust unit and integration testing
Wrote 550+ test cases, achieving high coverage across critical features

highlights.title: AG Grid Optimization & Bundle Chunking (~45% Faster Load Time)
details: Refactored large data-heavy modules using code-splitting and dynamic imports, significantly reducing initial load size
Optimized AG Grid rendering and state updates, resulting in a ~45% improvement in page load and render times for large datasets
Leveraged techniques like virtualization tuning, memoization, and selective column rendering to minimize unnecessary re-renders
Collaborated closely with the backend team to implement efficient pagination and data shaping strategies

experience.description: Worked on DeFi cryptocurrency web applications, including:

projects.name: InvestDex
projects.description: a DeFi web application built in React with custom Next.js and Chakra UI. Collaborated with a team on this project.

projects.name: Trifle Finance
projects.description: an in-house cryptocurrency exchange and DeFi application. Independently developed the web app using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

projects.name: Gimble Pay
projects.description: a payment integration for web applications. Worked on the front-end using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

projects.name: SPSQ
projects.description: a crypto trading platform originally built in jQuery. Converted it into an Electron React application for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

achievements: Developed a full-stack web application using modern technologies such as React, Node.js, and MongoDB.

experience.description: In my six months of work, I worked on an enterprise application aimed at providing pre-developed web app templates without the need for coding. Through this experience, I gained valuable insights into professional web development practices and industry standards.

I've worked as a freelancer on React web applications. One project I'm particularly proud of is the PVP Collage site, which I developed as a freelance project. It's a fully responsive website built using Next.js, Tailwind, and JavaScript. You can view the development link here: https://pvpcollage-loni-webapp.vercel.app/

education.university: P.V.P COLLAGE LONI, University of PUNE

projects.name: PVP Collage Website
projects.description: I'm particularly proud of is the PVP Collage site, which I developed. It's a fully responsive website built using Next.js, Tailwind, and JavaScript.

projects.name: Local Network Chat
projects.description: A Rust-based chat application that allows users to message each other on the same local network without an internet connection. It automatically discovers other users and provides a private, secure, and direct peer-to-peer connection.
projects.learning: This project was a deep dive into Rust, focusing on local network discovery, peer-to-peer communication, and building a fast, reliable, and privacy-focused application without a central server.

projects.name: SciNotepad
projects.description: A web-based notepad that performs instant calculations, supports variables, and includes a built-in plotting feature for visualizing mathematical functions. It's designed to be a powerful, user-friendly tool without relying on AI.
projects.details: Engineered for a seamless experience with features like multi-notebook management, automatic saving, a responsive design for all devices, and extensive keyboard shortcuts.

projects.name: Rust Web Scraper
projects.description: A web scraping application built with a Rust backend (Axum, SQLite) and a Rust-based frontend (egui) that runs natively and on the web via WebAssembly. It leverages Firecrawl for scraping and was built in collaboration with a partner who handled LLM-based scraping.
projects.learning: This was my first major Rust project, providing hands-on experience with building a full-stack application, including a backend API, a native GUI, and a WebAssembly frontend.

projects.name: AI Question Paper Solver
projects.description: A full-stack, AI-powered mobile app for iOS and Android that solves question papers. Built in just 48 hours, it demonstrates rapid development by augmenting human developers with an AI coding assistant.
projects.details: The app features core LLM integration, user plans with mock payment flows, and essential mobile navigation. This project showcased how to orchestrate AI tools to accelerate development from concept to a working product.

projects.name: Can I Eat
projects.description: An AI-assisted application designed to transform complex food labels into simple, easy-to-understand information. It provides visual health ratings, detailed ingredient analysis with allergen warnings, and a community contribution system.
projects.learning: This project demonstrated the power of AI agents in handling complex full-stack development. Key takeaways include the importance of mobile-first design for in-store scanning and the need for robust verification systems in community-driven applications.

projects.name: Algo-Visualized
projects.description: An interactive platform built in a single weekend with AI agents to visualize complex data structures and algorithms, including arrays, linked lists, hash tables, and sorting algorithms.
projects.learning: This project was an experiment in AI-assisted development, proving that human creativity paired with AI implementation can drastically reduce development time while maintaining high quality. The future of development is collaboration with AI.

projects.name: Mauli CSP
projects.description: I have built the Customer Support Portal as SaaS software. This website is focused on small and medium-sized shops, where shopkeepers can add entries for new products, sales, and track borrowings. The main focus was to provide easy access to statistics on inventory and sales.
projects.details: Here I have solo developed full backend and frontend both. I used React, TypeScript, Vite, and Ant Design for frontend, and for the backend, I have used Node.js, MongoDB, Mongoose, etc.
projects.learning: While building this project, the main learning was how to develop the project that is scalable and how to plan from the start so that it will be easy to add and remove big features. This project is a tremendous achievement for me, and I am still working to improve the project and add more features to it.
